intro: Lobelia santa-luciae, commonly known as Santa Lucia lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often found in cloud forests and alpine meadows, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
